reviews.text: A very simple place that is clean and well situated in PS. I would argue that you get as much here as in any resort, just not as glitzy. The price was very reasonable. They do run out of things like pool towels, but staff is very accommodating in trying to make up for it. Overall my wife & I are enjoying our stay.
reviews.title: What what you pay, this is a delight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: it's cozy, easy to reach, unique and very fun! The pool is great, the bar and the drinks were fabulous (happy hour lasted 2 hours ;)), the rooms very lovely. The bathrooms were small, but had everything one needs.
reviews.title: loved this place!

reviews.text: One of the best things to do in the evening is sitting by the fire and chatting with other guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: situated in the heart of palm springs, the movie colony hotel was a great find and a cozy getaway the manager, juana, was a most charming, knowledgeable young lady. the hotel features a variety of rooms and ours was comfortable with a well laid out plan, privacy included. there is a happy hour from 5 p.m. where you can mingle with other guests or be on your own. also available for the use of guests are bikes which you can ride through the really quiet neighborhood of the movie colony. a very satisfactory stay. enjoyed it very much. laurence acosta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights at Movie Colony and had a good time: Excellent value for money with free parking and complementary breakfast (from 08.30 - 10.30) + wifi, very comfortable beds and nice atmosphere. The pool itself is not very large and the space for the sun beds somewhat limited, and you better like the "evergreen" music (think Sinatra, Beatles, Elvis) that is played as background music throughout the day.
reviews.title: Timewarp gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff very friendly and the happy hour (from 17.30 - 18.30) was a nice touch.
reviews.title: That's Amore...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room (14) was large and comfortable, but beware of creaking noises from the upstairs room whenever anyone is walking around (it may be large to the rather large gentleman staying there, but think it was a general problem).
reviews.title: Add a Chapter to Your Life Story

reviews.text: Location is good but not great, as it is a 10-15 minutes walk to get to the abundance of restaurants that can be found in Palm Springs. Not a problem in March/April, but could imagine that it would be unbearable in summer, so car definitely needed.
reviews.title: Like stepping back into 1950's Hollywood!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff and super clean and tidy outdoor and indoor spaces show the love the owner has for this place. We had a patio room which was enough space for two on a short stay. Breakfast and cocktail hours (complimentary) were perfect. Lounging poolside in the 30C afternoons or soaking in the hot tub before bed made the stay here even better. Nice and close to the old strip and in a neighbourhood packed with old Hollywood style. A definite return spot for us...we loved it.
reviews.title: Wished we'd booked extra nights! Best part of trip!!

reviews.text: We just got back for PS and three nights at the MCH. I have always wanted to stay at this great piece of Frey architecture and we had a great excuse with friends in a house in the neighborhood. We needed a little separation from the house so the MCH turned into a fantastic treat and respite. We did do a Sunday to Wednesday break away so the rates where pretty good but when arrived Andrew gave us an upgrade to the Town House which proved to be heaven. These two story suites with patio and roof decks are so great – the décor is cool, modern, stylish, very well kept and comfortable. The layout perfect for us to have our own space when we needed it – sit by pool, take a nap, watch TV and not bother each other. The bed was divine comfortable and excellent linens. Waking up in the morning we just walk out to the pool, which is very clean then some breakfast from the bar which was always good – juice, good coffee, and bagel and so on. The town house was always cool and the aircon was perfect. The property is small which is super great with only a few guests and no kids!!! We walked to great restaurants, rode the bikes, and chatted with very cool guests especially with the happy hour in the early evening. The staff is professional and friendly. The MCH upgrade converted me to this hotel from the other boutique joints in PS. It was low key and private which the others with bars, restaurants, room service seem to lose compared to this architectural gem. We will be staying here again!!!
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel - Converted to the Movie Colony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful ambiance and personal guest service here. We felt like "stars" staying at The Movie Colony Hotel. Quiet, no kids, complimentary happy hour (and they came around to refill our wine glasses by the pool!!), lovely help yourself continental breakfast..... Original architecture re-done in a very modern way. No, its not the Westin...but if we wanted the Westin...we would have stayed there! Instead we opt for clean, funky, old PS style...and very personable staff...off the beaten track. Great Mexican restaurant right next door.
reviews.title: Feel like a star!
Loved it.
reviews.text: Great gettaway in the middle of palm springs! We stages for 3 nights in this lovely hotel and could easily have spend more days there. Great atmosphere, nice guests and the happy hour is good. Breakfast contains good bagels, cereals, yoghurt and fresh fruits. We didn't knowhow that the hotel only allows guests above 21 years but that made the poolside nice and relaxed. Definitely a place to go back to!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here over July 4th weekend, and had a wonderful experience. We usually stay at large resorts, so this was a big change! I don't think I've ever experienced nicer or more accommodating staff. It was quite obvious they all took their jobs, and our comfort, very seriously. It made me feel like a VIP.
reviews.title: Felt like I stepped back in time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I particularly liked the music that played around the pool, which was Frank Sinatra style. The music, along with the simple surroundings, made me feel like I lounging in a movie-star's backyard in the 1950s. Loved it!
reviews.title: Relaxing - will try a different place next time though

reviews.text: Great location and Best of all no kids!! Complimentary cocktail hour and tastefully decorated rooms. Furthermore you are not borhered too much by traffic from the road. Our pool villa had direct access to pool and private roof terrasse. I would stay there again!
reviews.title: Lovely quiet place

reviews.text: After spending time in Hollywood/Beverly Hills area, my niece and I took a little trek to Palm Springs to see the Marilyn sculpture. In keeping with a "movie theme" vacation we wanted a retro 1950-60s feel to the hotel we stayed in. We were there during off-season so waited until we arrived in PS to look for a place. The Visitor's Center provided us with 5-6 places and the first place we looked was the Movie Colony Hotel and we loved the black, white, silver and 60s sleekness of the lobby. Andrew and Juana at the desk were very receptive, gave us a good deal and showed us the room. That was it, we took it on the spot. We went right into the pool, met some friendly guests who, in some way, were associated with the movie business. There weren't any kids or teens and that was too our liking, but I think they're allowed. Loved the continental breakfast, bikes and Bobby Darin, Frank Sinatra, etc. soft music wafting through the hotel. This is a top-notch place to stay.
reviews.title: Loved the 1960s Ambiance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In spite of the bias of high expectations stemming from good reviews, we were not disappointed. As with restaurants, when you go at peak periods you often suffer from the swarm of the rush hour; likewise when there are few customers you can be unintentionally ignored with low staffing. We visited the Movie Colony at a time of very low occupancy, yet they went out of their way to make sure were were well taken care of, yet without overdoing it.
reviews.title: Great Time!

reviews.text: We intend to return!
reviews.title: Just a fantastic experience!

reviews.text: I flew out to Cali to see my husband before he deployed to Iraq and stayed at the hotel. The owner and guests were amazing and king. They made a very stressful time for us very relaxing and enjoyable! I will never forget hanging out at the gorgeous fire pit and sipping sake cocktails. I'm a real hotel snob and this place was in my top 3 ever.
reviews.title: Peaceful Desert Gem
